page.title: 10RELIGION
page.content: {Church of the Holy and Undivided {Trinity}Built in 1885 to replace a smaller one.It is built of gritstone with a porch,tower,steeple with bell and weather-vane.There is a grave yard a War Memorial and lych-gate. Reverend A. Murray-Leslie is the priest-in-charge,and is also Warden of Champion House. There is an organ and seats for 180. Two services are held every Sunday and a Sunday School. {Methodist Chapel.}This is at Barber Booth,a small rectangular building built of gritstone in 1811,surrounded by a graveyard. It seats about 50 people.There is a pedalled harmonium. There is no resident minister.The minister-in-charge is Reverend T. Nowell of Bradwell.There is a service once a fortnight at 3pm.
